text: The 2017 Women's Indoor Hockey Asia Cup was the 6th edition of the Indoor Hockey Asia Cup specifically for women. It was held in Doha, Qatar from 24–28 April 2017. The number of teams for this year’s cup has increased by one compared to the previous tournament where five teams competed. Cambodia and Hong Kong, who competed previously, not joined this year’s edition and be replaced by Malaysia, North Korea, and China. Kazakhstan defeated Malaysia in the final to win the cup and secured a place in 2018 Women's Indoor Hockey World Cup. ==Participating nations== Six countries are participating in this year's tournament: * * * * * * ==Umpires== # Frances Block (ENG) # Emily Carroll (AUS) # Hafizah Azman Nor (MAS) # Thanittha Chuangmanichot (THA) # Zarina Ilyassova (KAZ) # Ornpimol Kittiteerasopon (THA) # Weizhen Leong (SIN) ==Results== All times are in Qatar Standard Time (UTC+03:00). ===Pool=== \---- \---- \---- ===Classification=== ====Fifth and sixth place==== ====Third and fourth place==== ====Final==== ==Final standings== {| class="infobox bordered" |- |width=10px bgcolor=ccffcc| ||Qualified for 2018 Women's Indoor Hockey World Cup |} {| class="wikitable" !Rank !!width=170|Team |-bgcolor=ccffcc |align=center|File:gold medal icon.svg|| |- |align=center|File:silver medal icon.svg|| |- |align=center|File:bronze medal icon.svg|| |- |align=center|4|| |- |align=center|5|| |- |align=center|6|| |} ==References== ==External links== *Official website Indoor Hockey Asia Cup Women Category:Indoor Hockey Asia Cup Indoor Hockey Asia Cup Category:International women's field hockey competitions hosted by Qatar Indoor Hockey Asia Cup Women Category:Sports competitions in Doha Category:21st century in Doha
